SEARCH
Package gw.api.observability

Class DataDogReporter

java.lang.Object
gw.api.observability.DataDogReporter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObservabilityReporter
public class DataDogReporter extends Object implements ObservabilityReporter
DataDogReporter is an implementation of the ObservabilityReporter interface which does two things:

It assigns an Operation Name to the active span for the observered operation. This effectively changes the operation name from servlet.request (which is the default name provided by DataDog for POST requests) to the actual Designated Function Name. It does this by setting the operation name on the active span. In this case the active span is the top-most span of the request, assuming that no other guidewire-profiler tags have been entered.

It also reports two metrics to DataDog: one for the number of completed /failed operations for the function and another for the duration in milliseconds. The duration is sent as a Distribution so that median, 90%ile and 99%ile are available across all pods in the IS cluster.

Also, in both cases, Span and the Metrics are tagged with the contents of the MDC. The MDC is a ThreadLocal object that is expected to be populated by the applications with operation-specific data that is useful for the context of the operation.

The functions of naming the operation and sending the metrics are only performed when the environment variable DD_AGENT_HOST is defined. Otherwise this class is a nop-op. DD_AGENT_HOST is defined under gwcp via the yaml like this...

- name: DD_AGENT_HOST valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: status.hostIP

...so that the node that is hosting the container/pod with InsuranceSuite is assumed to have a datadog agent installed. That agent forwards traces (spans) and metrics to the correct DataDog account for the tenant/cluster.
